page.title: 09RESIDENTIAL UPMINSTER
page.content: This area is on the edge of{Greater {London}and is mainly a high class residential area for people who commute into the city for work.It was traditionally farmland with large Estates and Manor Houses .Some houses like the cottages by Harwood Hall are up to{300 years old. The first homes to be built in Upminster were in the early 1920's after the Railway came. Small businesses began to flourish and soon shops were being built.Postwar saw a second period of expansion.More modernized houses were built in the 1950's.The average price of a house in Upminster in 1985 is around Â£60,000 although many are more expensive.The majority have 3 bedrooms,lounge,dining room,bathroom & kitchen,but some have up to 6 bedrooms ,conservatory and extra toilets etc.
